categories.name: Agent Orchestration Depth
categories.description: Experience designing and implementing multi-agent systems with complex coordination patterns, state management, and orchestration logic

scoring_criteria.description: No evidence of multi-agent system experience; only single-agent or basic LLM API usage
indicators: Resume mentions only ChatGPT API calls or basic prompt engineering
No mention of agent coordination, workflows, or orchestration
Experience limited to chatbot UIs or simple Q&A systems

scoring_criteria.description: Some multi-agent experience but limited complexity or scale; may be experimental or academic
indicators: Built proof-of-concept multi-agent systems (e.g., AutoGPT-style projects)
Experience with agent frameworks (LangChain, CrewAI) but unclear production usage
Mentions 'agentic workflows' but lacks detail on orchestration complexity

scoring_criteria.description: Deep production experience with complex multi-agent orchestration, state management, and coordination patterns
indicators: Designed production systems with 3+ specialized agents working in coordination
Implemented advanced patterns: hierarchical agents, planning/execution splits, reflection loops
Clear evidence of handling agent state, memory, context management at scale
Experience with production observability for multi-agent systems

categories.name: LLM Integration Expertise
categories.description: Practical experience integrating LLMs into production systems with reliability, cost management, and structured outputs

scoring_criteria.description: No production LLM integration experience; only API exploration or tutorials
indicators: Experience limited to LLM playgrounds or notebook experiments
No mention of production deployment, error handling, or reliability
Resume shows only basic API usage without production context

scoring_criteria.description: Some production LLM integration but limited scope or maturity
indicators: Integrated LLMs into production systems with basic error handling
Experience with prompt engineering and basic output parsing
Mentions cost awareness but unclear optimization strategies

scoring_criteria.description: Extensive production LLM integration with advanced reliability and optimization techniques
indicators: Implemented structured outputs, function calling, or tool use in production
Built retry logic, fallback strategies, and guardrails for LLM failures
Optimized LLM costs through caching, prompt compression, or model selection
Experience with LLM observability: logging, tracing, latency monitoring

categories.name: Python & FastAPI Proficiency
categories.description: Strong Python engineering skills with FastAPI backend development experience

scoring_criteria.description: Limited Python experience; primarily uses other languages
indicators: Python listed but not featured in recent projects
No backend framework experience mentioned
Experience appears limited to scripts or data analysis

scoring_criteria.description: Solid Python experience with some backend development
indicators: Built backend services in Python (Flask, Django, or FastAPI)
Experience with async Python or API design
Comfortable with Python typing, Pydantic, or similar tools

scoring_criteria.description: Expert Python backend engineer with FastAPI production experience
indicators: Extensive FastAPI experience in production systems
Advanced Python patterns: async/await, type hints, dependency injection
Experience with Pydantic models, validation, and settings management
Built scalable Python services with proper error handling and testing

categories.name: System Design & Architecture
categories.description: Ability to design scalable, maintainable systems with thoughtful architectural decisions

scoring_criteria.description: No evidence of system design experience; primarily implements features from specs
indicators: Resume focuses on coding tasks without architectural context
No mention of design decisions, tradeoffs, or system planning
Experience limited to small scripts or single-component projects

scoring_criteria.description: Some system design experience with mid-sized projects
indicators: Designed APIs or backend services with multiple components
Experience with databases, caching, or message queues
Shows awareness of scalability or maintainability concerns

scoring_criteria.description: Strong system design skills with experience architecting complex systems
indicators: Designed distributed systems or microservices architectures
Made architectural decisions on state management, data flow, or service boundaries
Experience with system scalability, fault tolerance, or performance optimization
Clear evidence of designing for maintainability and extensibility

categories.name: Domain Knowledge: Hiring/Recruiting Tech
categories.description: Understanding of hiring workflows, ATS systems, or recruiting domain challenges

scoring_criteria.description: No hiring or recruiting domain experience
indicators: Resume shows no work in HR tech, recruiting, or talent management
No mention of ATS, resume parsing, or candidate evaluation systems
Domain experience is entirely outside hiring/recruiting

scoring_criteria.description: Some exposure to hiring workflows or recruiting technology
indicators: Built internal tools for hiring or candidate management
Experience with ATS integrations or resume parsing
Worked on HR-adjacent projects (e.g., employee management, onboarding)

scoring_criteria.description: Deep domain expertise in hiring tech or recruiting systems
indicators: Built or maintained ATS systems, recruiting platforms, or candidate evaluation tools
Experience with resume parsing, candidate matching, or interview scheduling
Clear understanding of hiring workflows and recruiter pain points
Work in talent acquisition, HR tech, or recruiting SaaS

categories.name: Developer Tools Product Experience
categories.description: Direct experience building or managing developer-focused products, tools, or platforms

scoring_criteria.description: No developer tools or platform experience; consumer product focus only
indicators: Resume shows only consumer-facing products (B2C apps, e-commerce, social media)
No mention of APIs, SDKs, CLI tools, or developer platforms
No evidence of understanding developer personas or workflows

scoring_criteria.description: Some developer tools exposure but limited scope or depth
indicators: Worked on internal developer tools but not external products
Managed APIs or integrations as part of larger product
Basic understanding of developer needs but limited execution experience

scoring_criteria.description: Extensive developer tools product experience with successful launches
indicators: Led developer-facing products: APIs, SDKs, CLI tools, developer platforms
Clear understanding of developer personas, adoption drivers, and friction points
Shipped products with strong developer adoption metrics (DAU, integrations, API calls)
Experience with developer relations, documentation, or community building

categories.name: Technical Depth & Engineering Collaboration
categories.description: Technical background enabling effective collaboration with engineering teams and technical decision-making

scoring_criteria.description: Non-technical background with limited engineering interaction
indicators: No engineering background or technical skills mentioned
Resume suggests handoff-style product management without deep technical collaboration
Unable to evaluate technical tradeoffs or architecture decisions

scoring_criteria.description: Technical literacy with ability to collaborate on engineering decisions
indicators: Technical degree or bootcamp background
Can read code and understand technical concepts
Works closely with engineering but defers most technical decisions

scoring_criteria.description: Strong technical background with engineering experience or deep technical product expertise
indicators: Prior engineering role or extensive coding experience
Makes technical product decisions: API design, architecture, performance tradeoffs
Can prototype, review PRs, or debug issues alongside engineering
Earns respect from engineering teams through technical credibility

categories.name: Product Strategy & Vision
categories.description: Ability to define product strategy, roadmap, and long-term vision aligned with market needs

scoring_criteria.description: Execution-focused PM without strategic product thinking
indicators: Resume emphasizes feature delivery without strategic context
No mention of roadmap planning, market analysis, or competitive positioning
Appears to take direction rather than set direction

scoring_criteria.description: Can develop product roadmaps with some strategic thinking
indicators: Created product roadmaps aligned with business goals
Conducted user research or market analysis to inform decisions
Balances short-term execution with longer-term planning

scoring_criteria.description: Strong product strategist with clear vision and market insights
indicators: Defined product vision and multi-year strategy
Deep market understanding: competitive landscape, trends, positioning
Successfully pivoted products or identified new market opportunities
Aligned cross-functional teams around clear product vision

categories.name: Data-Driven Decision Making
categories.description: Use of metrics, analytics, and experimentation to inform product decisions

scoring_criteria.description: Limited data or analytics usage; intuition-driven decisions
indicators: No mention of metrics, KPIs, or data analysis
Decisions appear based on opinions rather than data
No A/B testing or experimentation experience

scoring_criteria.description: Uses data to inform decisions with basic analytics
indicators: Tracks product metrics and KPIs
Conducts basic A/B tests or experiments
Makes data-informed decisions on feature prioritization

scoring_criteria.description: Sophisticated data-driven approach with advanced analytics and experimentation
indicators: Built comprehensive metrics frameworks and dashboards
Advanced experimentation: multi-variate tests, holdout analysis, causal inference
Uses data to uncover insights and drive product innovation
Experience with product analytics tools (Amplitude, Mixpanel, custom dashboards)

categories.name: Stakeholder Management & Communication
categories.description: Ability to align stakeholders, communicate effectively, and drive cross-functional execution

scoring_criteria.description: Limited stakeholder management or cross-functional leadership
indicators: Resume suggests individual contributor focus without cross-functional work
No evidence of executive communication or stakeholder alignment
Works primarily within single team or function

scoring_criteria.description: Effective stakeholder management within product teams
indicators: Aligns engineering, design, and business stakeholders
Communicates product updates and roadmaps to leadership
Resolves conflicts and drives consensus on product decisions

scoring_criteria.description: Expert stakeholder manager with executive influence and cross-org impact
indicators: Manages C-level stakeholders and drives executive alignment
Influences product strategy across multiple teams or business units
Exceptional communicator: writes compelling docs, presents to large audiences
Builds consensus across conflicting stakeholder priorities
